item.title: Paddy Jackson's Perpignan in grief ahead of Connacht game after former player killed in attack at his bar - Independent.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson's Perpignan in grief ahead of Connacht game after former player killed in attack at his bar  Independent.ie

Paddy Jackson's Perpignan has been plunged into grief after a former star player of the club was assaulted and killed outside his bar in the city centre last night.

item.title: Jackson: It would be great to play on Irish soil again - RTÉ News
item.description:
Jackson: It would be great to play on Irish soil again  RTÉ News

Paddy Jackson said he would like to play against Connacht next weekend in Galway but it remains to be seen if he will be making the trip to the Sportsground.

item.title: Paddy Jackson tipped for club switch in France - RTÉ News
item.description:
Paddy Jackson tipped for club switch in France  RTÉ News

Former Ireland outhalf Paddy Jackson has been linked with a move to Lyon next season. Jackson joined newly promoted Perpignan in June but the southern ...

item.title: Still no win for Perpignan as Bordeaux and Sharks triumph - Independent.ie
item.description:
Still no win for Perpignan as Bordeaux and Sharks triumph  Independent.ie

Former French powerhouse USA Perpignan will visit the Sportsground tomorrow week in the first of two European games between the sides in consecutive ...

item.title: Paddy Jackson linked with a move away from Perpignan - SportsJOE.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson linked with a move away from Perpignan  SportsJOE.ie

Former Ulster fly-half Paddy Jackson could be on the move again next season with his club side Perpignan currently languishing at the bottom of the Top 14.

item.title: Paddy Jackson and the Galway question - RugbyPass
item.description:
Paddy Jackson and the Galway question  RugbyPass

Paddy Jackson is theoretically free to go whenever he wants in Ireland. Ideally he should be in Galway next Saturday, running the show against Connacht as ...

item.title: Letters from France: Ongoing mayhem as Les Gilets Jaunes protesters refuse to play ball amid turmoil in France - Irish Examiner
item.description:
Letters from France: Ongoing mayhem as Les Gilets Jaunes protesters refuse to play ball amid turmoil in France  Irish Examiner

It’s tipping past 9pm on Saturday night and there are still about 15 Agen supporters hanging outside the back of the stand at Stade Pierre Fabre in Castres. There’s only a metre or two between the door from the dressing rooms and where the Agen team bus is parked up, engine running and the doors of the undercarriage wide open to take the gear bags. Agen, hovering with relegation since the season started but, thankfully for them, with Perpignan in a worse plight below them, they have just beaten the French champions in their own backyard. It took a late try to win it but it was a thoroughly ...

item.title: Perpignan - due to play Connacht tomorrow - in grief after former player killed in bar attack - Irish Examiner
item.description:
Perpignan - due to play Connacht tomorrow - in grief after former player killed in bar attack  Irish Examiner

Perpignan has been plunged into grief after a former star player of the club was assaulted and killed outside his bar in the city centre last night. The Perpignan squad heard of the news as they prepare for their Challenge Cup clash with Connacht tomorrow at the Sportsground in Galway. South Africa Barend Britz was a legendary figure for the club and played with current Perpignan coach Patrick Arlettaz for six years during which they won the Yves du Manoir Trophy in 1994. Paddy Jackson, who signed with Perpignan this year, has not travelled to Galway to play against Connacht. Perpignan have...

item.title: 'It's an exciting time. There's a great buzz around Galway and within the camp' - The42
item.description:
'It's an exciting time. There's a great buzz around Galway and within the camp'  The42

HOLIDAY SEASON IN Galway, and Connacht are back home again. There’s no shortage of cheer out west these days, with good reason too, and a capacity crowd is expected at the Sportsground this afternoon intent on kickstarting the festivities. Andy Friend’s men returned from their South Africa safari buoyed by nine match points, and as attention reverts back to Challenge Cup matters with the visit of Perpignan later [KO 3pm], this is a golden opportunity for the province to continue on that upward trajectory. Perhaps it is too early to say if Connacht have the capacity to course success on two ...

item.title: Perpignan's wretched season continues with 11th league loss - Independent.ie
item.description:
Perpignan's wretched season continues with 11th league loss  Independent.ie

Perpignan's hopes of a boost ahead of their Challenge Cup clashes with Connacht never looked like materialising in the winter sunshine at Stade Aime Giral for Sunday's lunchtime kick-off against Bordeaux-Begles. Paddy Jackson's (right) men led briefly but another sloppy and disjointed display saw them fall to their 11th defeat in a row in the Top 14 as they went down 22-11. The loss leaves them 11 points adrift of Grenoble at the foot of the table and two more points off Agen - the bottom team gets relegated automatically and the 13th-placed side plays off against the Pro D2 runners-up. Per...

item.title: No return to Connacht for Jackson with Perpignan - Independent.ie
item.description:
No return to Connacht for Jackson with Perpignan  Independent.ie

Relegation-threatened Top 14 club Perpignan have opted to give Paddy Jackson the weekend off which means he won't play on Irish soil for the first time since leaving Ulster earlier this year. The French strugglers play Connacht at the weekend in the Challenge Cup, but will leave a number of front-liners behind, including Jackson. The former Ireland out-half joined the Catalan club last summer after having his IRFU contract revoked following a highly public trial which saw him acquitted on charges of rape along with his former team-mate Stuart Olding, who is now at Brive. Difficulties While ...

item.title: Injury blow for Castres ahead of Munster clash as Rodrigo Capo Ortega doubtful - The42
item.description:
Injury blow for Castres ahead of Munster clash as Rodrigo Capo Ortega doubtful  The42

CASTRES’ INSPIRATIONAL CAPTAIN Rodrigo Capo Ortega is doubtful for their Heineken Champions Cup trip to Thomond Park next Sunday. The former Uruguayan lock limped off with a leg injury during Castres’ shockingly poor display at home to relegation-threatened Agen, a 16-13 loss which will not set any alarm bells ringing for Johann van Graan as they prepare for their double joust with the French champions. Castres, who should have lost away to bottom of the table Perpignan the previous week, were always chasing a poor game against Agen and sports director Christophe Urios has called for a resp...

item.title: Castres win again to warm up in style for Thomond Park trip - Independent.ie
item.description:
Castres win again to warm up in style for Thomond Park trip  Independent.ie

Munster and Castres will lock horns at Thomond Park on Sunday week for the first of their Champions Cup back-to-back games, and Johann van Graan's side will face an in-form outfit that are in the hunt for domestic and European honours. Last weekend the Top 14 made its return to action following the November internationals. And while the national team slipped up at home to Fiji, Castres picked up their second away win of the season at lowly Perpignan. Four Paddy Jackson penalties kept winless Perpignan in touch, but a first-half try from Scott Spedding proved the difference. Castres face Age...

item.title: France captain Guirado leaves Toulon for Top14 rivals - The42
item.description:
France captain Guirado leaves Toulon for Top14 rivals  The42

FRANCE CAPTAIN GUILHEM Guirado will be moving to Montpellier at the end of the season, the Top 14 club announced on Thursday. “It was a very important decision which needed a lot of thought. Now it is official I am very happy to be joining Montpellier,” Guirado told the club website. Guirado’s current side Toulon said last month that the 32-year-old hooker would be leaving at the end of the season and Montpellier have beaten Stade Francais to his signature. “I think I need the sea to live,” said Guirado. “I think that to succeed, you need good living conditions. “Montpellier want to succeed...

item.title: Paddy Jackson linked with a move from Perpignan to Top 14 rivals Lyon - Independent.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson linked with a move from Perpignan to Top 14 rivals Lyon  Independent.ie

A French media outlet is reporting that Paddy Jackson could be leaving Perpignan after just one season. According to French Lyon newspaper Le Progrés, Jackson is lined up as a possible replacement for Lionel Beauxis who will leave Lyon at the end of the season. A clause in Jackson's contract allows him to move on if his team are relegated from the Top 14, the report claims. They currently lie at the foot of the table and are nine points adrift of 13th-placed Agen. Last March, jury found Jackson (26) and fellow Ulster and Ireland player Stuart Olding (25) unanimously not guilty of rape. Both...

item.title: Leinster to play Perpignan away as pre-season friendlies are confirmed - Independent.ie
item.description:
Leinster to play Perpignan away as pre-season friendlies are confirmed  Independent.ie

Leinster will play three pre-season friendly fixtures this August, two of which will be played at home. The first friendly will be played on Friday, 11th August, away to USA Perpignan at 8pm (local time) at the Aimé Giral Stadium. Leinster last faced Perpignan, who currently play in French rugby's PRO D2, in the semi-finals of the 2003 Heineken Cup at Lansdowne Road which Perpignan won 14-21. The following Friday Leo Cullen's men will return home to face Gloucester Rugby at St Mary's RFC (KO 7.30pm). Leinster faced Gloucester in pre-season action last year at Tallaght Stadium with the provi...

item.title: Sale Sharks get their teeth into Perpignan in impressive display - Independent.ie
item.description:
Sale Sharks get their teeth into Perpignan in impressive display  Independent.ie

Sale Sharks, twice winners of the Challenge Cup, got their campaign up and running with an impressive 41-24 win away to Perpignan on Friday night. A crowd of 8,038 were in Stade Aime Giral for Perpignan's return to European action for the first time in five seasons and they gave Irish referee Joy Neville a hard time when she sent off hooker Manu Leiataua, at the end of the opening quarter. At that stage, the sides were deadlocked at 7-7 and while Perpignan hung on, they trailed 19-16 at the break. Jonathan Bousquet's fourth penalty tied the sides after 45 minutes, but Perpignan's indiscipli...

item.title: Bordeaux-Begles slip to third defeat ahead of trip to Galway - Independent.ie
item.description:
Bordeaux-Begles slip to third defeat ahead of trip to Galway  Independent.ie

Bordeaux-Begles fell to a third defeat of the season in the Top 14 when a second-half comeback came up short in Grenoble. The 28-25 result means that it is very much a mixed bag for Bordeaux-Begles as they arrive in Galway with three wins, three losses and a draw from the opening segment of games in France. They slipped to eighth place in the Top 14 after a revival in the second half when they were 28-10 down was not enough but tries from hooker Florian Dufour and winger Nans Ducuing secured a bonus point. Perpignan's hopes of ending their losing start to the season came unstuck when Pau st...

item.title: Irish abroad: Ryan's Racing sink O'Connell & Stade - RTÉ News
item.description:
Irish abroad: Ryan's Racing sink O'Connell & Stade  RTÉ News

A French battle between some of the most famous exiled names in Irish rugby went Racing 92's way as they halted Stade Francais's good start to the campaign. Donnacha Ryan got one over on Paul O'Connell and Mike Prendergast - both on the Stade coaching team - in an enthralling clash at the Stade Jean-Bouin. Simon Zebo was not in the panel but Ryan starred in a gritty Racing display. Stade raced into a 10-3 lead as Kylan Hamdaoui crashed over and Morne Steyn nailed a penalty. But Virimi Vakatawa’s response and two Finn Russell kicks got Racing going and though Steyn kept Stade ticking over o...

item.title: Simon Zebo and Finn Russell are doing wicked deeds over in Paris - SportsJOE.ie
item.description:
Simon Zebo and Finn Russell are doing wicked deeds over in Paris  SportsJOE.ie

Is Simon Zebo doing enough to be the exception to the rule? He can't do much better than he already is. Zebo was given a hefty pay bump to headfrom Munster to Racing 92, this summer, but he is proving to be a steal. The Ireland international scored within minutes of making his Racing debut in a friendly game against Brazil. He also scored on his competitive debut in the Top 14 and can't be stopped at the moment. On Saturday night, in Paris, Zebo had another cracking game in Racing colours. He made 82 metres off 12 carries, with three line breaks and six Castres defenders beaten. Two of thos...

item.title: Irish abroad: Ryan and Zebo help Racing to big win - RTÉ News
item.description:
Irish abroad: Ryan and Zebo help Racing to big win  RTÉ News

Former Ireland players Donnacha Ryan and Simon Zebo scored tries as Racing 92 claimed a facile win at home to Agen in the Top 14. Lock Ryan went over in the fourth minutes and Zebo, a 45th-minute replacement for Teddy Thomas, touched down with just under 20 minutes to play in the 59-7 win. A good nights work ???? Always fun dotting down ?????? Love my job ???? pic.twitter.com/EKwPb6Wr1w — Simon Zebo (@SimonZebo) September 8, 2018 Paddy Jackson kicked three penalties and a conversion in Perpignan’s 16-22 defeat to Lyon, while Paddy Butler helped Pau to a 24-21 away win at Grenoble, for whom ...

item.title: Sale devoured by Harlequins on opening day of Premiership - Independent.ie
item.description:
Sale devoured by Harlequins on opening day of Premiership  Independent.ie

Sale Sharks, Connacht's opponents in the second round of the Challenge Cup next month, made a dreadful start to their Premiership campaign when they were hammered 51-23 by Harlequins at The Stoop. AJ MacGinty, Connacht's out-half in the 2016 Pro12 triumph, scored Sale's opening try and kicked 13 points off the tee, but Steve Diamond's men were always chasing this one. Harlequins ran in six tries and Sale Sharks will now look to bounce back at AJ Bell Stadium on Sunday when they host Worcester Warriors. Paddy Jackson was off target with a long-range penalty at the death as Perpignan fell to ...

item.title: Donnacha Ryan and Simon Zebo both score as Racing 92 hammer Agen - SportsJOE.ie
item.description:
Donnacha Ryan and Simon Zebo both score as Racing 92 hammer Agen  SportsJOE.ie

The Munster men are off to a great start. Simon Zebo and Donnacha Ryan both scored for racing 92 as they racked up a half century of points against a hapless Agen side. Ryan and Zebo have been hard at it since early August and are well up to speed in the Top 14. Having lost at home to table-topping Clermont, last week, Racing got back on track by savaging the newly promoted Agen, 59-7. Virimi Vakatawa scored Racing's opener and Ryan called the ball on himself after Finn Russell's offload toTeddy Iribarenopened the hosts up. Credit: Top Rugby Nicolas Metge responded with a try for Agen but t...

item.title: Simon Zebo scores first try but Racing slip to heavy defeat at home to Clermont in Top 14 - Independent.ie
item.description:
Simon Zebo scores first try but Racing slip to heavy defeat at home to Clermont in Top 14  Independent.ie

Simon Zebo scored his first try for Racing but he couldn't prevent the French side from falling to a 40-17 defeat in their Top 14 clash with Clermont this afternoon. Zebo made his Top 14 debut last weekend in Racing's win away to Toulon and again started at full-back against Clermont this evening, but despite the former Ireland international getting on the scoreboard it was not a day to remember for his new employers. Scotland scrum-half Greig Laidlaw scored 17 points for the visitors as Clermont made a statement of intent on the second weekend of action in the Top 14, tries from Wesley Fof...

item.title: Cork Con man Quinlan takes pro rugby shot in the south of France - The42
item.description:
Cork Con man Quinlan takes pro rugby shot in the south of France  The42

TOMÁS QUINLAN IS just coming off the beach in 30°C heat when we speak and he’s happy to report that his new life in Narbonne has been “pretty perfect” so far. The 23-year-old out-half joined the French club in July after impressing consistently for Cork Con in the AIL in recent years. Many people in Cork rugby are firm in their belief that Quinlan should still be part of the Munster system, but he was let go by the province in 2016 after one season in their academy. Having shone for Con since, Quinlan now gets the chance to be a professional player with Racing Club de Narbonne Méditerannée,...

item.title: Donnacha Ryan lays out 20-stone 'Tongan Bear' with ferocious tackle - SportsJOE.ie
item.description:
Donnacha Ryan lays out 20-stone 'Tongan Bear' with ferocious tackle  SportsJOE.ie

Loni Uhila, welcome to Paris! It was a frustrating, sapping return to competitive action at the U Arena for Racing 92 but Donnacha Ryan and SimonZebo gave them a couple of decent memories. Racing wereabsolutely savaged by Clermont Auvergenein their second Top 14 game of the season, with Greig Laidlaw chipping in with 17 points in a 40-17 victory. The Clermont pack made hay in Paris as they won penalty after penalty in the first half, with Laidlaw making them pay off the kicking tee. 15 minutes into the contest, however, and Ryan looked to gather some momentum for his team with a steam-train...

item.title: Paul O'Connell's Stade hammer Paddy Jackson's Perpignan in Top 14 opener - Irish Examiner
item.description:
Paul O'Connell's Stade hammer Paddy Jackson's Perpignan in Top 14 opener  Irish Examiner

Paddy Jackson made his Top14 debut this afternoon but his Perpignan side were on the receiving end of a heavy defeat by Stade Francais. Perpignan are back in the Top14 having been promoted after their first ever relegation four seasons ago. The ex-Ulster out-half scored a try but his side fell to a 46-15 home defeat. Former Ireland captain Paul O'Connell was also making his debut in French rugby, having been announced as the new Stade forwards coach earlier this month. O'Connell Read More: has been backed to be a success as a coach by his former teammate and current Crusaders coach Ronan O'...

item.title: Paddy Jackson suffers heavy defeat on Top 14 debut as Paul O'Connell's Stade Francais get flying start - Independent.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson suffers heavy defeat on Top 14 debut as Paul O'Connell's Stade Francais get flying start  Independent.ie

It was an inauspicious return to professional rugby for Paddy Jackson as his Perpignan side were well-beaten by Stade Francais in their opening Top 14 game this afternoon. The ex-Ulster and Ireland fly-half did score a try in his first appearance in the Top 14 since his move to Perpignan, but he could do little to prevent his side from falling to a comprehensive 46-15 defeat. Jackson started at fly-half and played 70 minutes for the newly-promoted club, but they were never a match for a Stade Francais despite the visitors losing legendary Italian number eight Sergio Parisse to a red card la...

item.title: Simon Zebo off to winning start with Racing after victory over Toulon on Top 14 debut - Independent.ie
item.description:
Simon Zebo off to winning start with Racing after victory over Toulon on Top 14 debut  Independent.ie

Simon Zebo's time in France got off to an ideal start as his Racing side won their opening Top 14 clash away to three-time European champions Toulon this evening. The former Ireland international started at full-back and played the full 80 minutes in an electric back three alongside Argentinian winger Juan Imhoff and All Blacks legend Joe Rokocoko, while fellow Munster man Donnacha Ryan also started for the French club. Toulon took a narrow 6-3 lead into the break at the Stade Mayol, but two tries in three second-half minutes from new signing Finn Russell put Racing in control. Juan Imhoff ...

item.title: Paddy Jackson's Perpignan hammered by Stade Francais on Top 14 debut - SportsJOE.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson's Perpignan hammered by Stade Francais on Top 14 debut  SportsJOE.ie

Welcome back to the big leagues. Perpignan had a decent pre-season after their promotion to the Top 14 but their first league game of the season saw them shredded by Stade Francais. Paddy Jackson contributed eight points but his new side were soundly beaten. Stade, who have Paul O'Connell and Mike Prendergast on their coaching staff, annihilated Perpignan on their home turf - Stade Aim Giral - and the contest was effectively over by half-time. Sekou Macalou scored a first-half brace and there were further tries fromKylan Hamdaoui andWaisea Vuidravuwalu - along with three conversions and a p...

item.title: Try-scoring Top 14 debut for Jackson but Perpignan thumped by 14-man Stade - The42
item.description:
Try-scoring Top 14 debut for Jackson but Perpignan thumped by 14-man Stade  The42

IRISH OUT-HALF PADDY Jackson scored a try on his Top 14 debut this afternoon, but his Perpignan side suffered a heavy loss in the opening game of the campaign against 14-man Stade Francais. Jackson started in the number 10 jersey for his new club after moving to France over the summer. The 26-year-old crossed in the second half but it proved to be a mere consolation as Stade romped to a 46-15 victory at Stade Aime Giral, despite the dismissal of Sergio Parisse shortly before the interval. The Italian number eight was harshly shown red on 36 minutes for leading with the elbow in contact, a d...

item.title: Catalans Dragons’ win shows rugby league can fulfil expansion dream - The Guardian
item.description:
Catalans Dragons’ win shows rugby league can fulfil expansion dream  The Guardian

The celebrations in Perpignan will continue for a good while yet following Catalans Dragons’ Challenge Cup triumph on Saturday but for the sport itself the question is where such a historic moment can take rugby league. Les Dracs’ 20-14 win against Warrington at Wembley was a triumph against adversity on numerous levels, not least given the tumultuous history of French rugby league: in the midst of the second world war the pro-Nazi Vichy government banned the sport in France in 1940. For rugby league in general – with an elite level still viewed by some as played along the M62 corridor in t...

item.title: In breaking free of their past, Catalans Dragons have carved out a bright new future for themselves - The Independent
item.description:
In breaking free of their past, Catalans Dragons have carved out a bright new future for themselves  The Independent

It was long gone midnight when the charter plane touched down at Perpignan Airport, carrying 19 victorious Catalans Dragons players and one hefty silver trophy. And yet it was immediately clear that nobody was going anywhere in a hurry. From wall to wall, the tiny terminal building heaved with humanity and shook with song; a weary squad shuffled through the throng overjoyed Dragons fans, raising the Challenge Cup to the heavens as if presenting it for approval. This was not the first time the Challenge Cup had seen French soil. It had occasionally been flown to Perpignan on promotional tour...

item.title: Ronan O’Gara tips Paulie to pass coaching test in Paris - Irish Examiner
item.description:
Ronan O’Gara tips Paulie to pass coaching test in Paris  Irish Examiner

Ronan O’Gara believes former Munster and Ireland team-mate Paul O’Connell is testing the water for a career in coaching with his first full-time job as a forwards coach at Stade Francais. The French Top 14 campaign begins today with O’Connell’s new Parisian club away at Paddy Jackson’s newly-promoted Perpignan, the 38-year-old former Ireland skipper having joined head coach Heyneke Meyer and a backroom team also including fellow Munsterman Mike Prendergast as backs coach. In moving to France, O’Connell has followed O’Gara, who cut his coaching teeth across the capital at Racing 92 and is no...

item.title: Catalans Dragons rise to Challenge glory - RTÉ News
item.description:
Catalans Dragons rise to Challenge glory  RTÉ News

Catalans Dragons won their first major trophy with a historic 20-14 victory over Warrington Wolves in the Challenge Cup Final at Wembley. The French side scored tries through Lewis Tierney, Benjamin Garcia and Brayden Wiliame, with the excellent Josh Drinkwater kicking four goals, including two superb conversions from the touchline. Warrington responded with tries from Ben Murdoch-Masila and George King but Steve McNamara's side defended their six-point advantage heroically in the closing stages to become the first non-English side to lift the trophy. "It was incredible for us. We played re...

item.title: Catalans Dragons 20 Warrington Wolves 14: French side make history to become first non-English Challenge Cup winners - The Telegraph
item.description:
Catalans Dragons 20 Warrington Wolves 14: French side make history to become first non-English Challenge Cup winners  The Telegraph

France’s golden summer of sport continued with a historic afternoon at Wembley Stadium as Catalans Dragons won their first Challenge Cup. The victory over seven-time winners and favourites Warrington Wolves made them the first French winners as well as the first non-English champions in the competition’s history. Coached by former England coach Steve McNamara, Dragons were the better team for the first 55 minutes, maintaining good discipline and high tempo while undermining Warrington’s composure. It was very much an underdog tale as Catalans had barely survived relegation from Super League...

item.title: Catalans stun Warrington in Challenge Cup final to make history as first non-British title winners - The Independent
item.description:
Catalans stun Warrington in Challenge Cup final to make history as first non-British title winners  The Independent

The Blood and Gold finally have some silver. After 80 minutes of guts and grit and almost unimaginable tension, the release: the victorious Catalans Dragons players charging towards their little pocket of fans at Wembley Stadium’s northern end, the few who could afford to make the trip. This was the 117th Challenge Cup final, and until now all 116 of them had been won by an English team. Until now. From Perpignan in the south-west of France: a new name on the oldest trophy in the game, and a result whose reverberations will be felt throughout the entire sport. Underdogs on the day, underdog...

item.title: Paddy Jackson impresses as Perpignan beat Zebo and Ryan's Racing 92 - SportsJOE.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson impresses as Perpignan beat Zebo and Ryan's Racing 92  SportsJOE.ie

The former Ulster outhalf is settling in nicely at his new club. French rugby players don't get much of a break at all. Six weeks after the French national side finished up their three-Test tour of New Zealand, the country's Top 14 and Pro D2 sides were back out in pre-season matches. Forget this 11-month season talk. In France, it's about 363 days of the year. For Irish players like Simon Zebo, Donnacha Ryan and Paddy Jackson, who are not currently involved in the national team, getting straight into 2018/19 is something to relish. First game with my @racing92 family, Reunited on the field...

item.title: 'People don't get what I've been through' - Paddy Jackson - Independent.ie
item.description:
'People don't get what I've been through' - Paddy Jackson  Independent.ie

Paddy Jackson said people might not be able to understand what he has been through unless they experienced something similar but he is determined to push on with his life on and off the rugby pitch. Jackson has moved to the south of France after securing a two-year contract with Top 14 side Perpignan and he made an impressive debut for the Catalan club last Thursday against Toulouse in a pre-season friendly. Jackson is the star summer signing for Perpignan, who were relegated for the first time in their 116-year history four seasons ago and who have recently been promoted back to the top fl...

item.title: Paddy Jackson makes impression on Perpignan debut after 14 months out of the game - Independent.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson makes impression on Perpignan debut after 14 months out of the game  Independent.ie

Paddy Jackson produced a strong debut performance for Perpignan as his rugby exile came to an end over a year since he last played. Jackson, who played the opening half of their pre-season clash with Toulouse at Stade Aime Giral before Perpignan changed their entire team at the interval, showed few signs of being out of action since winning his 25th cap for Ireland against Japan in June last year. The 26-year old was handed a difficult opening conversion after eight minutes when Australian Zack Holmes scored in the right corner but Jackson landed the kick and grew in confidence after that. ...

item.title: Paddy Jackson set for first rugby match since June 2017 as he prepares for Thursday debut with Perpignan - Independent.ie
item.description:
Paddy Jackson set for first rugby match since June 2017 as he prepares for Thursday debut with Perpignan  Independent.ie

Former Ireland and Ulster out-half Paddy Jackson will play his first professional rugby match in over a year tomorrow as Perpignan begin their pre-season schedule with a game against Toulouse. Jackson last took to the field on Ireland's summer tour against Japan in June 2017, before sitting out the entire 2017/18 season while he was on trial for rape. The number ten was acquitted in March after the much publicised trial, with the IRFU and Ulster subsequently cancelling his contract before he was signed by French side Perpignan. The newly-promoted outfit have named Jackson in their squad to ...

item.title: Paul O'Connell and Paddy Jackson set for early encounter in Top 14 - SportsJOE.ie
item.description:
Paul O'Connell and Paddy Jackson set for early encounter in Top 14  SportsJOE.ie

The Stade Aim Giral will be the scene for some significant Irish rugby interest near the end of this month. France's Top 14 league starts on the weekend of August 24-26 and there is a match on the fixture list that will draw a lot of Irish eyes. While Donnacha Ryan and Simon Zebo will be hoping to line out for Racing 92, at the Stade Mayol, against Toulon, there is a very interesting clash in store in France's Basque region. At 1:45pm local time, Saturday August 25, will officially mark the beginning of Paddy Jackson and Paul O'Connell's Top 14 careers. The former Ireland teammates will be ...

item.title: Paddy Jackson set to make first rugby appearance in over a year on Thursday - The42
item.description:
Paddy Jackson set to make first rugby appearance in over a year on Thursday  The42

FORMER ULSTER OUT-HALF Paddy Jackson is set to return to the rugby pitch for the first time in over a year after being named in Perpignan’s squad for their pre-season fixture with Toulouse. Jackson last took to the field in Ireland colours during their summer Test with Japan in June of 2017. An IRFU and Ulster Rugby review saw the 26-year-old Lisburn native and his former provincial and international teammate Stuart Olding relieved of their Ulster contracts with immediate effect last April, a month after the conclusion of the Belfast rape trial. In March, Jackson and Olding were acquitted o...
